title: 2016 UEFA Women's Champions League Final
text:
The 2016 UEFA Women's Champions League Final was the final match of the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">2015–16 UEFA Women's Champions League</a>, the 15th season of Europe's premier women's club <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament organised by <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a>, and the seventh season since it was renamed from the UEFA Women's Cup to the <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">UEFA Women's Champions League</a>. It was played at the <a href="Mapei%20Stadium%20%E2%80%93%20Citt%C3%A0%20del%20Tricolore">Mapei Stadium – Città del Tricolore</a> stadium in <a href="Reggio%20Emilia">Reggio Emilia</a>, Italy, on 26 May 2016, between German team <a href="VfL%20Wolfsburg%20%28women%29">Wolfsburg</a> and French team <a href="Olympique%20Lyonnais%20%28Ladies%29">Lyon</a>.
<a href="Olympique%20Lyonnais%20%28Ladies%29">Lyon</a> defeated <a href="VfL%20Wolfsburg%20%28women%29">Wolfsburg</a> 4–3 on penalties (1–1 after extra time) to win their third European title.
Background.
The final was a rematch of the <a href="2013%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League%20Final">2013 final</a>, won by Wolfsburg 1–0. This was the ninth successive final with at least one German team, and the sixth final in seven years between a French team and a German team.
Both teams had won the tournament twice. <a href="VfL%20Wolfsburg%20%28women%29">Wolfsburg</a> won successive finals in <a href="2013%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League%20Final">2013</a> and <a href="2014%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League%20Final">2014</a>, while <a href="Olympique%20Lyonnais%20%28Ladies%29">Lyon</a> reached four successive finals, winning in <a href="2011%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League%20Final">2011</a> and <a href="2012%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League%20Final">2012</a>, but losing in <a href="2010%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League%20Final">2010</a> and <a href="2013%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League%20Final">2013</a>, all facing German opponents.
Road to the final.
"Note: In all results below, the score of the finalist is given first (H: home; A: away)."
Match.
Officials.
Hungarian referee <a href="Katalin%20Kulcs%C3%A1r">Katalin Kulcsár</a> was announced as the final referee by UEFA on 10 May 2016.
Details.
The "home" team (for administrative purposes) was determined by an additional draw held after the quarter-final and semi-final draws, which was held on 27 November 2015 at UEFA headquarters in <a href="Nyon">Nyon</a>, Switzerland.
